context_of_use: This use case allows an admin to manage user accounts, create products, update product prices, and maintain inventory within the system.
stakeholders_and_interests: admin: Control system access and manage product offerings
description: This use case enables admins to manage user accounts, create products, update product prices, and maintain inventory.
triggering_event: Admin initiates management of catalog and users.
preconditions: Admin is logged into the system.
Admin has the necessary permissions to manage users and products.
postconditions: User accounts are updated as per admin actions.
New products are created and available for purchase.
Product prices are updated in the system.
assumptions: The admin has access to the necessary tools and interfaces to perform management tasks.
requirements_met: The system shall allow admins to manage user accounts.
The system shall allow admins to create new products.
The system shall allow admins to update product prices.
The system shall allow admins to manage inventory levels.
outstanding_issues: Clarification on the specific permissions required for different admin tasks.
main_flow: 1. Admin selects the option to manage user accounts → System displays user management interface.
2. Admin updates user account details → System saves changes and confirms update.
3. Admin selects the option to create new products → System displays product creation form.
4. Admin enters product details and submits → System creates the product and confirms creation.
5. Admin selects the option to update product prices → System displays current product prices.
6. Admin updates product prices and submits → System saves the new prices and confirms update.
7. Admin selects the option to manage inventory → System displays current inventory levels.
8. Admin updates inventory levels and submits → System saves the new inventory levels and confirms update.
